titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr., Notebook MC 75
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Norma Chaires.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-06-08T10:58-0400

did.abstract: Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr., graduated from the University of the City of New-York (later New York University) in 1883. The collection comprises his student notebook, dated January 1883.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in one series by topic which contains one folder with the student notebook of Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr., attended the University of the City of New-York from 1879 to 1883. He was enrolled in the Departments of Arts and of Science. From 1879 to 1883, the Catalogue of the University of the City of New-York listed his home in Brooklyn. Anthony graduated from the University of the City of New-York in 1883.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
New York University Archives Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012 Phone: (212) 998-2646 Fax: (212) 995-4225 E-mail: university-archives@nyu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr., Notebook; MC 75; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the student notebook of Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr. The notebook is entitled: "Notes Volume II: Statics Dynamics Hydraulics." According to Anthony, the notes are based on notes of Professor Gillespie of Union College, rearranged and corrected by Professor Charles B. Brush, professor of Civil Engineering at New York University, to which are added extracts from "Merrill's Iron Truss bridges" and various other data obtained from the investigation, experience, and practice of Spielman and Brush, Civil Engineers.

controlaccess.subject: Universities and colleges |x Alumni and alumnae.
